text:
hi, some time ago i submitted a bug (?) about winnt_accept error, apache was 
not working for several minute or hours, several time a day. The developers 
rejected because it was not a bug.
Well, what i noticed (also because i had probelm with other application server) 
is: the error is generated ONLY if there is more than 1 network card on a PC, 
we had 2, as soon as we removed one, Apache didn't give any problem anymore.
The error.log message WAS:
(720064)The specified network name is no longer available.  : winnt_accept: 
Asynchronous AcceptEx failed.
creator: korfut@lycos.com

text:
Hi,
we have the same problem: Apache was not working for some time (1- 20 sec) and 
in the error.log appears the messages: "(OS64)The specified network name is no 
longer available.  : winnt_accept: Asynchronous AcceptEx failed" (up to 6-7 
times at sec). At increasing load the problem accures more frequent and for 
longer time. In this time all processes of the server also standing still. For 
example, it was impossible to copy from another machine to this server. If i 
uninstall apache, there was no more problems with this server althought we 
stress him. 

We have removed the second network card. It does'nt help. Last night i'm 
updated the Apache to 2.0.45. No effect. We updated the drivers, reinstall the 
services packs, checked the whole servers hardware and software. Nothing helps.

Greetings,
Ilona
creator: ifischer@is24.de

text:
I believe this is fixed in 2.0.50.  Just add "Win32DisableAcceptEx" to the
configuration file.
creator: chip@force-elite.com
